00001 /**
00002  * \file RandomNumber.hpp
00003  * \brief Header for RandomNumber
00004  *
00005  * Infinite precision random numbers.

00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_RANDOMNUMBER_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_RANDOMNUMBER_HPP \
00014   "$Id: e40bc1451b8493a049c12fae697352606b9b79da $"
00015 
00016 #include <vector>
00017 #include <iomanip>
00018 #include <limits>
00019 #include <cmath>                // for std::pow
00020 
00021 namespace RandomLib {
00022   /**
00023    * \brief Infinite precision random numbers.
00024    *
00025    * Implement infinite precision random numbers.  Integer part is non-random.
00026    * Fraction part consists of any some number of digits in base
00027    * 2<sup><i>b</i></sup>.  If \e m digits have been generated then the
00028    * fraction is uniformly distributed in the open interval
00029    * sum<sub><i>k</i>=1</sub><sup><i>m</i></sup>
00030    * <i>f</i><sub><i>k</i>-1</sub>/2<sup><i>kb</i></sup> +
00031    * (0,1)/2<sup><i>mb</i></sup>.  When a RandomNumber is first constructed the
00032    * integer part is zero and \e m = 0, and the number represents (0,1).  A
00033    * RandomNumber is able to represent all numbers in the symmetric open
00034    * interval (-2<sup>31</sup>, 2<sup>31</sup>).  In this implementation, \e b
00035    * must one of 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, or 32.  (This restriction
00036    * allows printing in hexadecimal and can easily be relaxed.  There's also no
00037    * essential reason why the base should be a power of 2.)
00038    *
00039    * @tparam bits the number of bits in each digit.
00040    **********************************************************************/
00041   template<int bits = 1> class RandomNumber {
00042   public:
00043     /**
00044      * Constructor sets number to a random number uniformly distributed in
00045      * (0,1).
00046      **********************************************************************/
00047     RandomNumber() throw() : _n(0), _s(1) {}
00048     /**
00049      * Swap with another RandomNumber.  This is a fast way of doing an
00050      * assignment.
00051      *
00052      * @param[in,out] t the RandomNumber to swap with.
00053      **********************************************************************/
00054     void swap(RandomNumber& t) throw() {
00055       if (this != &t) {
00056         std::swap(_n, t._n);
00057         std::swap(_s, t._s);
00058         _f.swap(t._f);
00059       }
00060     }
00061     /**
00062      * Return to initial state, uniformly distributed in (0,1).
00063      **********************************************************************/
00064     void Init() throw() {
00065       STATIC_ASSERT(bits > 0 && bits <= w && (bits < 4 || bits % 4 == 0),
00066                     "RandomNumber: unsupported value for bits");
00067       _n = 0;
00068       _s = 1;
00069       _f.clear();
00070     }
00071     /**
00072      * @return the sign of the RandomNumber (+/- 1).
00073      **********************************************************************/
00074     int Sign() const throw() { return _s; }
00075     /**
00076      * Change the sign of the RandomNumber.
00077      **********************************************************************/
00078     void Negate() throw() { _s *= -1; }
00079     /**
00080      * @return the floor of the RandomNumber.
00081      **********************************************************************/
00082     int Floor() const throw() { return _s > 0 ? int(_n) : -1 - int(_n); }
00083     /**
00084      * @return the ceiling of the RandomNumber.
00085      **********************************************************************/
00086     int Ceiling() const throw() { return _s > 0 ? 1 + int(_n) : - int(_n); }
00087     /**
00088      * @return the unsigned integer component of the RandomNumber.
00089      **********************************************************************/
00090     unsigned UInteger() const throw() { return _n; }
00091     /**
00092      * Add integer \e k to the RandomNumber.
00093      *
00094      * @param[in] k the integer to add.
00095      **********************************************************************/
00096     void AddInteger(int k) throw() {
00097       k += Floor();             // The new floor
00098       int ns = k < 0 ? -1 : 1;  // The new sign
00099       if (ns != _s)             // If sign changes, set f = 1 - f
00100         for (size_t k = 0; k < Size(); ++k)
00101           _f[k] = ~_f[k] & mask;
00102       _n = ns > 0 ? k : -(k + 1);
00103     }
00104     /**
00105      * Compare with another RandomNumber, *this < \e t
00106      *
00107      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00108      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00109      * @param[in,out] t a RandomNumber to compare.
00110      * @return true if *this < \e t.
00111      **********************************************************************/
00112     template<class Random> bool LessThan(Random& r, RandomNumber& t) {
00113       if (this == &t) return false; // same object
00114       if (_s != t._s) return _s < t._s;
00115       if (_n != t._n) return (_s < 0) ^ (_n < t._n);
00116       for (unsigned k = 0; ; ++k) {
00117         // Impose an order on the evaluation of the digits.
00118         const unsigned x = Digit(r,k);
00119         const unsigned y = t.Digit(r,k);
00120         if (x != y) return (_s < 0) ^ (x < y);
00121         // Two distinct numbers are never equal
00122       }
00123     }
00124     /**
00125      * Compare RandomNumber with two others, *this > max(\e u, \e v)
00126      *
00127      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00128      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00129      * @param[in,out] u first RandomNumber to compare.
00130      * @param[in,out] v second RandomNumber to compare.
00131      * @return true if *this > max(\e u, \e v).
00132      **********************************************************************/
00133     template<class Random> bool GreaterPair(Random& r,
00134                                             RandomNumber& u, RandomNumber& v) {
00135       // cmps is set to false as soon as u <= *this, and likewise for cmpt.
00136       bool cmpu = this != &u, cmpv = this != &v && &u != &v;
00137       if (!(cmpu || cmpv)) return true;
00138       // Check signs first
00139       if (cmpu) {
00140         if (u._s > _s) return false; // u > *this
00141         if (u._s < _s) cmpu = false;
00142       }
00143       if (cmpv) {
00144         if (v._s > _s) return false; // v > *this
00145         if (v._s < _s) cmpv = false;
00146       }
00147       if (!(cmpu || cmpv)) return true; // u <= *this && v <= *this
00148       // Check integer parts
00149       if (cmpu) {
00150         if ((_s < 0) ^ (u._n > _n)) return false; // u > *this
00151         if ((_s < 0) ^ (u._n < _n)) cmpu = false;
00152       }
00153       if (cmpv) {
00154         if ((_s < 0) ^ (v._n > _n)) return false; // v > *this
00155         if ((_s < 0) ^ (v._n < _n)) cmpv = false;
00156       }
00157       if (!(cmpu || cmpv)) return true; // u <= *this && v <= *this
00158       // Check fractions
00159       for (unsigned k = 0; ; ++k) {
00160         // Impose an order on the evaluation of the digits.  Note that this is
00161         // asymmetric on interchange of u and v; since u is tested first, more
00162         // digits of u are generated than v (on average).
00163         const unsigned x = Digit(r,k);
00164         if (cmpu) {
00165           const unsigned y = u.Digit(r,k);
00166           if ((_s < 0) ^ (y > x)) return false; // u > *this
00167           if ((_s < 0) ^ (y < x)) cmpu = false;
00168         }
00169         if (cmpv) {
00170           const unsigned y = v.Digit(r,k);
00171           if ((_s < 0) ^ (y > x)) return false; // v > *this
00172           if ((_s < 0) ^ (y < x)) cmpv = false;
00173         }
00174         if (!(cmpu || cmpv)) return true; // u <= *this && v <= *this
00175       }
00176     }
00177     /**
00178      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00179      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00180      * @param[in] k the index of a digit of the fraction
00181      * @return digit number \e k, generating it if necessary.
00182      **********************************************************************/
00183     template<class Random> unsigned Digit(Random& r, unsigned k) {
00184       ExpandTo(r, k + 1);
00185       return _f[k];
00186     }
00187     /**
00188      * Add one digit to the fraction.
00189      *
00190      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00191      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00192      **********************************************************************/
00193     template<class Random> void AddDigit(Random& r)
00194     { _f.push_back(RandomDigit(r)); }
00195     /**
00196      * @param[in] k the index of a digit of the fraction
00197      * @return a const reference to digit number \e k, without generating new
00198      *   digits.
00199      *
00200      * This will throw an exception if the digit hasn't been generated.
00201      **********************************************************************/
00202     const unsigned& RawDigit(unsigned k) const throw()
00203     { return (const unsigned&)(_f.at(k)); }
00204     /**
00205      * @param[in] k the index of a digit of the fraction
00206      * @return a non-const reference to digit number \e k, without generating
00207      *   new digits.
00208      *
00209      * This will throw an exception if the digit hasn't been generated.
00210      **********************************************************************/
00211     unsigned& RawDigit(unsigned k) throw()
00212     { return (unsigned&)(_f.at(k)); }
00213     /**
00214      * Return to initial state, uniformly distributed in \e n + (0,1).  This is
00215      * similar to Init but also returns the memory used by the object to the
00216      * system.  Normally Init should be used.
00217      **********************************************************************/
00218     void Clear() {
00219       std::vector<unsigned> z(0);
00220       _n = 0;
00221       _s = 1;
00222       _f.swap(z);
00223     }
00224     /**
00225      * @return the number of digits in fraction
00226      **********************************************************************/
00227     unsigned Size() const throw() { return unsigned(_f.size()); }
00228     /**
00229      * Return the fraction part of the RandomNumber as a floating point number
00230      * of type RealType rounded to the nearest multiple of
00231      * 1/2<sup><i>p</i></sup>, where \e p =
00232      * std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits, and, if necessary, creating
00233      * additional digits of the number.
00234      *
00235      * @tparam RealType the floating point type to convert to.
00236      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00237      * @param[in,out] r a random generator for generating the necessary digits.
00238      * @return the fraction of the RandomNumber rounded to a RealType.
00239      **********************************************************************/
00240     template<typename RealType, typename Random> RealType Fraction(Random& r) {
00241       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer,
00242                     "RandomNumber::Fraction: invalid real type RealType");
00243       const int d = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
00244       const int k = (d + bits - 1)/bits;
00245       const int kg = (d + bits)/bits; // For guard bit
00246       RealType y = 0;
00247       if (Digit(r, kg - 1) & (1U << (kg * bits - d - 1)))
00248         // if guard bit is set, round up.
00249         y += std::pow(RealType(2), -d);
00250       const RealType fact = std::pow(RealType(2), -bits);
00251       RealType mult = RealType(1);
00252       for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) {
00253         mult *= fact;
00254         y += mult * RealType(i < k - 1 ? RawDigit(i) :
00255                              RawDigit(i) & (~0U << (k * bits - d)));
00256       }
00257       return y;
00258     }
00259     /**
00260      * Return the value of the RandomNumber rounded to nearest floating point
00261      * number of type RealType and, if necessary, creating additional digits of
00262      * the number.
00263      *
00264      * @tparam RealType the floating point type to convert to.
00265      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00266      * @param[in,out] r a random generator for generating the necessary digits.
00267      * @return the value of the RandomNumber rounded to a RealType.
00268      **********************************************************************/
00269     template<typename RealType, class Random> RealType Value(Random& r) {
00270       // Ignore the possibility of overflow here (OK because int doesn't
00271       // currently overflow any real type).  Assume the real type supports
00272       // denormalized numbers.  Need to treat rounding explicitly since the
00273       // missing digits always imply rounding up.
00274       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer,
00275                     "RandomNumber::Value: invalid real type RealType");
00276       const int digits = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00277         min_exp = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent;
00278       RealType y;
00279       int lead;               // Position of leading bit (0.5 = position 0)
00280       if (_n) lead = highest_bit_idx(_n);
00281       else {
00282         int i = 0;
00283         while ( Digit(r, i) == 0 && i < (-min_exp)/bits ) ++i;
00284         lead = highest_bit_idx(RawDigit(i)) - (i + 1) * bits;
00285         // To handle denormalized numbers set lead = max(lead, min_exp)
00286         lead = lead > min_exp ? lead : min_exp;
00287       }
00288       int trail = lead - digits; // Position of guard bit (0.5 = position 0)
00289       if (trail > 0) {
00290         y = RealType(_n & (~0U << trail));
00291         if (_n & (1U << (trail - 1)))
00292           y += std::pow(RealType(2), trail);
00293       } else {
00294         y = RealType(_n);
00295         int k = (-trail)/bits;  // Byte with guard bit
00296         if (Digit(r, k) & (1U << ((k + 1) * bits + trail - 1)))
00297           // If guard bit is set, round bit (some subsequent bit will be 1).
00298           y += std::pow(RealType(2), trail);
00299         // Byte with trailing bit (can be negative)
00300         k = (-trail - 1 + bits)/bits - 1;
00301         const RealType fact = std::pow(RealType(2), -bits);
00302         RealType mult = RealType(1);
00303         for (int i = 0; i <= k; ++i) {
00304           mult *= fact;
00305           y += mult *
00306             RealType(i < k ? RawDigit(i) :
00307                      RawDigit(i) & (~0U << ((k + 1) * bits + trail)));
00308         }
00309       }
00310       if (_s < 0) y *= -1;
00311       return y;
00312     }
00313     /**
00314      * Return the range of possible values for the RandomNumber as pair of
00315      * doubles.  This doesn't create any additional digits of the result and
00316      * doesn't try to control roundoff.
00317      *
00318      * @return a pair denoting the range with first being the lower limit and
00319      *   second being the upper limit.
00320      **********************************************************************/
00321     std::pair<double, double> Range() const throw() {
00322       double y = _n;
00323       const double fact = std::pow(double(2), -bits);
00324       double mult = double(1);
00325       for (unsigned i = 0; i < Size(); ++i) {
00326         mult *= fact;
00327         y += mult * RawDigit(i);
00328       }
00329       return std::pair<double, double>(_s > 0 ? y : -(y + mult),
00330                                        _s > 0 ? (y + mult) : -y);
00331     }
00332     /**
00333      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00334      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00335      * @return a random digit in [0, 2<sup><i>bits</i></sup>).
00336      **********************************************************************/
00337     template<class Random> static unsigned RandomDigit(Random& r) throw() {
00338       return unsigned(r.template Integer<bits>());
00339     }
00340 
00341   private:
00342     /**
00343      * The integer part
00344      **********************************************************************/
00345     unsigned _n;
00346     /**
00347      * The sign
00348      **********************************************************************/
00349     int _s;
00350     /**
00351      * The fraction part
00352      **********************************************************************/
00353     std::vector<unsigned> _f;
00354     /**
00355      * Fill RandomNumber to \e k digits.
00356      **********************************************************************/
00357     template<class Random> void ExpandTo(Random& r, size_t k) {
00358       size_t l = _f.size();
00359       if (k <= l)
00360         return;
00361       _f.resize(k);
00362       for (size_t i = l; i < k; ++i)
00363         _f[i] = RandomDigit(r);
00364     }
00365     /**
00366      * Return index [0..32] of highest bit set.  Return 0 if x = 0, 32 is if x
00367      * = ~0.  (From Algorithms for programmers by Joerg Arndt.)
00368      **********************************************************************/
00369     static int highest_bit_idx(unsigned x) throw() {
00370       if (x == 0) return 0;
00371       int r = 1;
00372       if (x & 0xffff0000U) { x >>= 16; r += 16; }
00373       if (x & 0x0000ff00U) { x >>=  8; r +=  8; }
00374       if (x & 0x000000f0U) { x >>=  4; r +=  4; }
00375       if (x & 0x0000000cU) { x >>=  2; r +=  2; }
00376       if (x & 0x00000002U) {           r +=  1; }
00377       return r;
00378     }
00379     /**
00380      * The number of bits in unsigned.
00381      **********************************************************************/
00382     static const int w = std::numeric_limits<unsigned>::digits;
00383   public:
00384     /**
00385      * A mask for the digits.
00386      **********************************************************************/
00387     static const unsigned mask =
00388       bits == w ? ~0U : ~(~0U << (bits < w ? bits : 0));
00389   };
00390 
00391   /**
00392    * \relates RandomNumber
00393    * Print a RandomNumber.  Format is n.dddd... where the base for printing is
00394    * 2<sup>max(4,<i>b</i>)</sup>.  The ... represents an infinite sequence of
00395    * ungenerated random digits (uniformly distributed).  Thus with \e b = 1,
00396    * 0.0... = (0,1/2), 0.00... = (0,1/4), 0.11... = (3/4,1), etc.
00397    **********************************************************************/
00398   template<int bits>
00399   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const RandomNumber<bits>& n) {
00400     const std::ios::fmtflags oldflags = os.flags();
00401     RandomNumber<bits> t = n;
00402     os << (t.Sign() > 0 ? "+" : "-");
00403     unsigned i = t.UInteger();
00404     os << std::hex << std::setfill('0');
00405     if (i == 0)
00406       os << "0";
00407     else {
00408       bool first = true;
00409       const int w = std::numeric_limits<unsigned>::digits;
00410       const unsigned mask = RandomNumber<bits>::mask;
00411       for (int s = ((w + bits - 1)/bits) * bits - bits; s >= 0; s -= bits) {
00412         unsigned d = mask & (i >> s);
00413         if (d || !first) {
00414           if (first) {
00415             os << d;
00416             first = false;
00417           }
00418           else
00419             os << std::setw((bits+3)/4) << d;
00420         }
00421       }
00422     }
00423     os << ".";
00424     unsigned s = t.Size();
00425     for (unsigned i = 0; i < s; ++i)
00426       os << std::setw((bits+3)/4) << t.RawDigit(i);
00427     os << "..." << std::setfill(' ');
00428     os.flags(oldflags);
00429     return os;
00430   }
00431 
00432 } // namespace RandomLib
00433 
00434 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_RANDOMNUMBER_HPP
